overview: Moses, prophet and leader (Exodus 2-Deuteronomy 34), delivered Israel from Egypt (1446 BC), received Law at Sinai, led 40 years in wilderness. Humble servant of God (Numbers 12:3).
path: Born in Egypt during oppression (Exodus 2:1-10), raised by Pharaoh's daughter (possibly Hatshepsut). Killed Egyptian, fled to Midian (Exodus 2:11-22). Burning bush call (Exodus 3-4). Returned for plagues/Exodus (Exodus 5-12). Red Sea crossing, Sinai covenant (Exodus 13-19). Wilderness wanderings (Numbers), spies report (Numbers 13-14), death at Mount Nebo overlooking Promised Land (Deuteronomy 34).
archaeology: Merneptah Stele (1208 BC earliest 'Israel' mention, implying Exodus before). Serabit el-Khadim inscriptions (1800 BC Proto-Sinaitic possibly 'Moses'). Pi-Ramesses (Ramses II city matching Exodus 1:11). Amarna letters (14th BC Canaan unrest aligning with conquest). No direct Moses artifact, but 15th century BC context fits patriarchal era.
writings_readings: Authored Pentateuch per tradition (Exodus-Deuteronomy). Psalm 90 (Moses' prayer). Referenced in Joshua 1, Hebrews 11:23-29 (faith hall). Miracles: Plagues, manna, water from rockâ€”types of God's provision.
chronology: Birth ~1526 BC (Exodus timing from 1 Kings 6:1). Exodus 1446 BC. Death 1406 BC before Jordan crossing.
